@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars.remediation: Remove the unused variable/import. If it must exist for structural reasons (destructuring, callback signature), prefix with _ (e.g., _unusedVar).

@typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any.remediation: Replace 'any' with a specific type. Use 'unknown' if truly unknown, then narrow with type guards. For JSON data use Record<string, unknown>.
examples: function parse(input: unknown): Result { if (typeof input === 'string') { ... } }

@typescript-eslint/no-require-imports.remediation: Replace require() with an ES import statement. This project uses TypeScript import syntax.
examples: import foo from './foo';  // instead of: const foo = require('./foo')

@typescript-eslint/ban-ts-comment.remediation: Remove the @ts-ignore comment. Fix the underlying type error instead. If unavoidable, use @ts-expect-error with a reason: // @ts-expect-error - <reason>

@typescript-eslint/no-unused-expressions.remediation: Expression has no effect. Assign the result to a variable, pass as an argument, or remove the statement. Common cause: missing function call parentheses.

no-var.remediation: Replace 'var' with 'const' (if never reassigned) or 'let' (if reassigned).

prefer-const.remediation: Variable is never reassigned after initialization. Change 'let' to 'const'.

prefer-rest-params.remediation: Replace 'arguments' with rest parameters (...args). Rest params are typed and produce real arrays.

prefer-spread.remediation: Replace .apply() with spread syntax: fn(...args) instead of fn.apply(null, args).

@typescript-eslint/no-array-constructor.remediation: Use array literal [] instead of new Array(). For typed empty arrays: const arr: string[] = [];

@typescript-eslint/no-duplicate-enum-val.remediation: Each enum member must have a unique value. Remove or change the duplicate.

@typescript-eslint/no-empty-object-type.remediation: Replace {} with a specific type. Use Record<string, never> for empty objects, 'object' for any non-primitive, or 'unknown'.

@typescript-eslint/no-extra-non-null-ass.remediation: Remove the extra '!' non-null assertion. One is sufficient: obj!.prop (not obj!!.prop).

@typescript-eslint/no-misused-new.remediation: Interfaces should not have a 'new' constructor signature. Use a class instead.

@typescript-eslint/no-namespace.remediation: Replace 'namespace' with ES modules (import/export). TypeScript namespaces are legacy.

@typescript-eslint/no-non-null-asserted-.remediation: Remove '!' after optional chain '?.'. The optional chain already handles null/undefined.

@typescript-eslint/no-this-alias.remediation: Remove 'const self = this'. Use arrow functions to preserve 'this' context.

@typescript-eslint/no-unnecessary-type-c.remediation: Remove 'extends unknown' or 'extends any' from generic â€” it's the default constraint.
examples: function foo<T>() {}  // not: function foo<T extends unknown>() {}

@typescript-eslint/no-unsafe-declaration.remediation: Do not merge an interface with a class of the same name. Rename one of them.

@typescript-eslint/no-unsafe-function-ty.remediation: Replace 'Function' type with a specific function signature: (...args: unknown[]) => unknown

@typescript-eslint/no-wrapper-object-typ.remediation: Use primitive types (string, number, boolean) instead of wrapper objects (String, Number, Boolean).

@typescript-eslint/prefer-as-const.remediation: Replace type assertion with 'as const': const x = 'foo' as const;

@typescript-eslint/prefer-namespace-keyw.remediation: Use 'namespace' keyword instead of 'module'. But prefer ES modules over both.
